title: 'Why I allowed my teenage son to have a nose job'
text:
What would you do if your child wanted a cosmetic treatment, as Sallie Laing’s son Ollie did when he was just 18? It’s a dilemma more parents are facing – one fraught with emotional and ethical complexities, as Louise Court discovers

Sallie Laing was shocked when her son Ollie requested a nose job for his 18th birthday. ‘You think your children are the most gorgeous things on earth, so why would they want to change anything?’ she says. ‘I wasn’t aware that Ollie was unhappy with his looks.’ But he was unhappy – desperately so.

‘I was about 16 when I decided I didn’t like my nose,’ he explains. ‘School was a bit of a fashion show, and I started being called names. Because I was self-conscious...
